A war is brewing in the US over who controls the money supply!

Time for a thread breaking down ðŸ‘‡

-The attack that's currently being waged on the Federal Reserve
-The Treasuries attempts to introduce a â€˜â€™digital greenbackâ€™â€™
-Bidenâ€™s executive order on CBDC's

1/

To understand why a war has been waged on the Federal reserve, we need to understand why someone would want to attack them in the first place

Ever since the Fed began meddling in the markets in 1913,  they've created enormous distortions in the boom and bust cycle

2/

Weâ€™ve seen central banks all around the world, using their inflationary policies to create some enormous asset bubbles all around the world over the past century

These asset bubbles benefit the rich who're able to store their wealth in assets, easier than the everyday person

3/

These asset bubbles and uncontrollable monetary inflation have destroyed the purchasing power of our money.

Inflation disproportionately hurts the lower and middle class of society.

Under our current monetary system,  the rich get richer, the poor get poorer

4/

Many people ask, ''just how long can these central bankers get away with this for?''

Well, weâ€™ve seen many attempts to end central banks in the past. 

And today, we're witnessing another one of these attacks, and it's coming from the US government itself. 

5/

On the 28th of March, a group of US lawmakers introduced a bill called The â€˜â€™ECASH Act,â€™â€™ into the House Committee on Financial Services.

If the bill passed, it would allow the Treasury to test the creation and distribution of a â€˜digital dollar,â€™ completely bypassing the Fed

6/

The treasury says the â€˜â€™ECASH will be a digital analog to the â€˜â€™greenback.â€™â€™

Now, whatâ€™s the important link here about the mention of a â€˜â€™greenbackâ€™â€™?

The origins and backstory of the original greenback dollar relate to the current war on money that weâ€™re witnessing today. 

7/

Abraham Lincoln did exactly what the treasury is proposing today, when he created the greenback dollar in 1862. 

The infamous American civil war began in 1861, and Lincoln quickly realized the war was going to be more expensive than he originally envisaged. 

8/

The bankers, who were wishing the Union to fail, offered Lincoln loans at predatory interest rates between 24% and 36%,.

Lincoln declined, and simply proceeded to printed 450 million dollars worth of the new bills using green ink on the back, birthing the ''Greenback.''

9/

Now, this ECASH proposal came only 2 weeks after we received the long-awaited results of Bidenâ€™s executive order on digital currency.

The order requires the treasury department to URGENTLY investigate how the Fed can implement CBDCs, and report back to Biden within 180 days

10/

However, CBDCâ€™s donâ€™t appear to be popular with all members of the US government. 

US Representative Tom Emmer, and Texas senator, Ted Cruz, have both submitted bills to disallow the Federal Reserve from creating a CBDC.

11/

So the question remains, how will the money wars unfold in the US?

Will the Fed lose its power to create money?

Will the treasury sieze the power to create money?

Will the US create a CBDC?

How does #bitcoin fit into all of this?
